panel.html: This Dashboard displays specific information about outliers for your specific combination of data (Host/Sourcetype/Index). This was built around the same framework that can be found in this blog series by the Splunk Machine Learning Toolkit team. It can be utlized to interpret when outliers were detected in your data, so you can investigate even further as to what may be going on.

Panel Descriptions
Frequency of Sending Cumulative Frequency Analysis of the selected Host/Index/Sourcetype for the selected timeframe.
Minimum # of Data Points for a Time Period This panel will give you information about the minimum number of data points for a selected timeframe. If you're Looking at 60 days worth of data, you should have at least 8 or 9 data points. If you have anything less, this means you were missing data and your outlier detections are going to be less accurate.
Number of Low Outliers Because most people care about "Low Outliers" (Too Little Data) vs. "High Outliers" (Too Much Data), this metric will show you how many low outliers exist in your data.
Outliers Timeline This timeline will show you a timechart of when your outliers were found. You can click through on this panel to see an advanced analysis of the selected combination of data.
